data.title: Base64 Encoding Length Calculator
data.statement:
You are working on a secure messaging system for a military communications team. Before transmitting encrypted messages, the system encodes them in Base64 to ensure compatibility with legacy network protocols. However, to optimize bandwidth usage, you need to precompute the exact size of the Base64-encoded payload without generating the full encoding.

Your task is to write a program that calculates the length of a Base64-encoded string without performing the actual encoding (which could be slow for large messages).

<<MATHEMATICAL FORMULA>>
Use the following formula to calculate the length of the Base64 encoded version of a string [[s]]:
4 * INTEGER_PART( (LENGTH([[s]]) +2)/3 )
data.constraints:
1 ≤ length([[s]]) ≤ 100

The string [[s]] may contain any printable ASCII character.
data.inputDescription: A single string variable [[s]] consisting of ASCII characters (may include spaces, symbols, etc.).
data.outputDescription: A single integer representing the length of the Base64 encoding of [[s]].

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are working on a secure messaging system for a military communications team. Before transmitting encrypted messages, the system encodes them in Base64 to ensure compatibility with legacy network protocols. However, to optimize bandwidth usage, you need to precompute the exact size of the Base64-encoded payload without generating the full encoding.

Your task is to write a program that calculates the length of a Base64-encoded string without performing the actual encoding (which could be slow for large messages).

MATHEMATICAL FORMULA
Use the following formula to calculate the length of the Base64 encoded version of a string s:
4 * INTEGER_PART( (LENGTH(s) +2)/3 )
Input
A single string variable s consisting of ASCII characters (may include spaces, symbols, etc.).
Output
A single integer representing the length of the Base64 encoding of s.
Constraints
1 ≤ length(s) ≤ 100

The string s may contain any printable ASCII character.
Example
Input
abc
Output
4
